measured_by: use of suboptimal one-dimensional categorization rule (1D)
justification: The authors state that they "examined whether increasing levels of summative feedback would reduce learning trap formation, as indexed by use of suboptimal one-dimensional rules (1D) instead of an optimal two-dimensional rule (2D)."

measured_by: classification as 2D vs 1D rule user based on approach/avoid choices
justification: "The key outcome measure was the type of categorization rule that participants used to guide approach/avoid decisions… participants were classified as '2D rule users' or '1D rule users' if their approach choices were consistent with the relevant rule on at least 15 out of 16 trials."

topic_or_construct: explicit beliefs about predictive feature dimensions
measured_by: checkbox selection of feature dimensions believed relevant
justification: "Participants' explicit beliefs about which dimensions predicted category membership were assessed… participants checked boxes to indicate the dimensions that they believed were most relevant to bee classification."
"Participants started with a balance of 50 points… An on-screen counter tallied the current points earned, and was updated after each trial."
